node.title: Improve your Writing (Confused Words)
node.author: dragonslayer109
node.body:
It all is a lot clearer now, ironic right? Confused words are often used and this is because it sounds right, but it is not. These words sound so similar, this is where the problem comes in.

http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-FXHMs7el33Q/VHTS5_wRx7I/AAAAAAAAFts/qvHVhcbtoOc/s1600/How-to-Improve-Your-Writing-Skills.jpeg
[Image credit](http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-FXHMs7el33Q/VHTS5_wRx7I/AAAAAAAAFts/qvHVhcbtoOc/s1600/How-to-Improve-Your-Writing-Skills.jpeg)

Homophones
----------

This is the biggest cause for all the confusing words one can read in someones writing. Why English decided to do this... well if you ask me they just wanted to be difficult. If the English language just decided to be simple and not so confusing, this would all be gone and we would never have to worry about it. 

https://i.ytimg.com/vi/z9pXiFG3z5M/hqdefault.jpg
[Image credit](https://i.ytimg.com/vi/z9pXiFG3z5M/hqdefault.jpg)

If you ask me English causes a lot of stress and unnecessary worry. It is making me old and grey with all it's rules and exceptions, and extra exceptions to the exceptions.

**Accept/Except**
Accept:Is a verb, this means that someone or something is doing the accepting.
	
I accept you for being who you are.
I do not accept your laziness.

Except: Is a word that functions like "excluding".
	
I love ice-cream, except when it is melted.
Most days are sunny during winter except when there is a cold front.
 
**Affect/Effect** 
This is one I often get wrong. A way that I have learnt how to tell the difference, is the **A**. The **A** represents action.

Affect: Is a verb, where something or someone is affecting something else.
	That story affected me more than the others.

Effect: is usually a noun.
	That story *had* an **effect** on my life.

See how the *had* is now the verb and **effect** is a noun.

**Its/Itâ€™s**
Its: is possessive.
	The clown lost its red nose.

It's: is a contraction of "it is".
	It's going to be a rainy day today.

We always think that the apostrophe shows possession "Tim's car", but its is similar to the words his and her, therefore its is possession. With "It's" just break it up into it is 

**Loose/Lose**
Another one I struggle with. Whenever you need to use loose/lose in the context of, you lost something, just replace the *t* with an *e* to get the right one.

Loose: is not tight, but loose.
	The door was loose.

Lose: in the past tense is *lost*.
	You will lose this game if you keep playing like this.

**To/Too**
Too: indicates, *excess* or means *also*.
	I too want to got to the movie
	It is way too much food for me to eat

To: must be used in all other circumstances.

**Weather/Whether**
When it comes to this one just think of water, there is no *h* in water, therefore weather relates to the conditions around us.
	The  weather is looking bad today, we will get rain.

Whether: is proceeded by an opinion
	Weather or not it rains, I will be happy.

There are many many more of these words. To have a look at more and do some short exercises go to:[Link](https://pathway.brightspace.com/content/enforced/30521-Pathway.2017.Spring.ENG106.1086/Course%20Files/Lesson%2012/Confused%20Words%20new.pdf?_&d2lSessionVal=4LWcerBF5FCnmd8TJBRWVPBAw&ou=30521)
 
 https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/736x/cf/46/4b/cf464bb731bbb3c608b39836a180a43b--creative-writing-writing-tips.jpg
 [Image credit](https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/736x/cf/46/4b/cf464bb731bbb3c608b39836a180a43b--creative-writing-writing-tips.jpg)

*Just on a little side note for self improvement. I will be doing pushups, situps and squats for the amount of $$$ (ratio;$1:1) I earn on this post and will give a short feedback every day at the end of each post. This will be split in equally between all 3. Any not done will carry onto the next day.*

node.title: Twice in 7 days, Iran talks of 'oppressed' Kashmir, India
node.author: codingdefined
node.body:
For the second time in a week, Iran's 'supreme leader' Ayatollah Khamenei made comments about Kashmir, urging support for its "oppressed Muslims", reported the Islamic Republic News Agency (IRNA).

In 2010, when Khamenei spoke of Kashmir, India summoned the then acting Iranian Ambassador to register its protest, So far, there has been no statement from New Delhi on Khamenei's latest comments.

node.title: Factory Steemit hits 1097 Followers!! ALL POST SBD Giveaway!! wo0ho0!!
node.author: b0y2k
node.body:
https://s6.postimg.org/611ijlr75/followers.jpg

Wow! So i logged in this morning and was checking my posts, replying to everyone here and then it hit me!! 1097 Followers!! Holy Moly! 

The support from every single one of you guys has been amazing. When i started this project my main aim was to promote steemit and share my passions with the people here. i have been blown away by the amount of support and also the amount of people telling me that they are now getting into motocross just because of my posts, that's amazing!

So far in my time here i have sponsored other people, given away shirts i have had designed, sponsored the ENTIRE team of kids and adults at my local motocross club (36 riders and kits!) and also run some competitions where i designed, printed and sent out custom shirts. I did this all because of your support! :)

[Custom #factorysteemit Shirts](https://steemit.com/motocross/@b0y2k/steemit-factory-racing-custom-shirts-have-arrived)
[Sponsoring team kit for my local club](https://steemit.com/motocross/@b0y2k/factory-steemit-pics-from-the-compass-cup)
[Sponsoring Team rider Brad Clements](https://steemit.com/supercross/@b0y2k/factory-steemit-round-6-iden-adult-a-mx1-photos)
[Sponsoring Ssekulji Rally car](https://steemit.com/factorysteemit/@b0y2k/factory-steemit-sponsor-ssekulji-for-his-rally-season)

I cannot thank you all enough for backing me with your votes and confidence, you have all allowed me to follow some of my dreams and i continue to do so everyday.

So to say a little thank you i wish to run a little fun giveaway which hopefully will make a big impact with some of my followers. What better way than a nice Steem dollar giveaway :)

All comments on this post by the end of the 7 day posting period  will be entered into the competition and all the SBD will be split amongst the three winning people.

# I will split the coins as follows:
 | Place | Prize |
 | ---- | ---- |
 | 1st | 60% |
 | 2nd | 25% |
 | 3rd | 15% |

I will use randompicker to generate the results and they will be public and 100% fair.
https://www.randompicker.com/

The winners can power up, buy themselves something nice or just go out and have a good time :)

Thank you again #steemit for all your support! Love you all and good luck!

----------------------------------
# Follow me for #factorysteemit and motocross news!

node.title: Miss. Delicious #68 : Poseidon's Table - A restaurant worthy of Gods!
node.author: sweetsssj
node.body:
## Dear Steemit friends : ![IMG_9772.jpg](https://steemitimages.com/DQmWAwH9LhV7ZbpHUqjoi4Ef1PxZefGFpHheWcSaxrpja4x/IMG_9772.jpg) The Atlantis resort in Bahamas has surely drawn the attention of many travellers who seek their own answers to the mystery of the ancient lost city. After thousands of years submerged under the sea, curious explorers now have the chance to make their own pilgrimage to this Utopian relic. Our adventures thus far have taken us to [The Dig](https://steemit.com/travel/@sweetsssj/travel-with-me-70-the-dig-at-the-lost-city-of-atlantis) where partial ruins of the ancient city have now become the permanent home of a thriving marine ecosystem, buzzing with life. Since the 19th century, historians have renewed their interest in origins of Atlantis, looking for clues as to where the advanced kingdom sank in just one day and one night. Whispers of the Greek island, Santorini remain a subtle yet plausible theory. My own adventures exploring [Santorini and it's magical sea](https://steemit.com/life/@sweetsssj/kissing-santorini-s-magical-blue-sea) served only as a cathartic temporary release of my curiosity, ultimately leading my travels to Bahamas for further affirmation. The [Big Chair](https://steemit.com/travel/@sweetsssj/travel-with-me-73-a-look-at-the-atlantis-casino-from-a-non-gambler) belonging to Poseidon, gave us a glimpse to where the mighty Olympian once sat as he ruled his Kingdom. Though indeed a God, Poseidon and the other Olympians walked among the realm of the mortals, ruling undetected as they presided over their areas of control.
![poseidon.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmUMHjq7YUNVpEK5g58cHikBcJuZoGBa32xyCe4fw7t5SG/poseidon.png)
http://www.poseidonspantry.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/05/poseidon-blank-worn1.png
### Poseidon ***Poseidon*** was of course, the Greek god of the sea. After defeating the Titans, the world was divided into three. Poseidon drew the Sea straw and hence forth became the protector of all waters as well as all those who depended on them for safe passage. He wields a three-pronged spear also called a ***Trident*** allowing him to strike the ground producing an earthquake. For this reason, Poseidon was also known as ***"The Earth Shaker"***. Known for being arrogant, moody, and always flaunting his masculinity, Poseidon no doubt commanded a God worthy appetite. My expeditions as ***Miss. Delicious*** takes us deep into his place of banquet. ***Poseidon's Table***, a place that delivers both the quantity and quality of food, only worthy of a powerful deity. Dining here is a privilege, one bestowed upon us by right of abode in the heart of Atlantis. What food, fit for a God and his Godly appetite can we expect? Join me in the feast and let's find out!
http://image.ibb.co/c5mOfF/DSC00219.jpg Just a minutes walk away from Poseidon's Big Chair. We see the marvellous entrance to ***Poseidon's Table***. His Trident piercing through the name as a reminder of his unwieldy power. http://image.ibb.co/hE2w0F/DSC00822.jpg Entering the main court, we begin to see a style of decor that mimics the unwavering motions of the sea. A wall with a myriad of bubble like holes echoing Poseidon's position as God of the Sea. http://image.ibb.co/b60G0F/DSC00880.jpg Enormous bottles frame the upper portion of the walls. Their size, a reminder of the unearthly size of the Gods. ![DSC00934.JPG](https://steemitimages.com/DQmcTSAZET3FF3T864LoByxg8tt3v6p1yyf1WxXxWNvVRWz/DSC00934.JPG) http://image.ibb.co/k6MZnv/DSC00932.jpg Behind the wall, the food awaits. Section by section, row by row, food of all sorts await our picking. Let's go through and have a look. http://image.ibb.co/d4294a/IMG_7827.jpg ***Roasted Vegetables*** http://image.ibb.co/hc1OfF/DSC00882.jpg ***Fruits*** http://image.ibb.co/fNFG0F/DSC00883.jpg ***Salads*** http://image.ibb.co/eqR0Sv/DSC00884.jpg Lots of different Cheeses and cured ham / meat. http://image.ibb.co/dpUb0F/DSC00887.jpg http://image.ibb.co/m9grHv/IMG_7837.jpg http://image.ibb.co/gTp0AF/IMG_7836.jpg Even more pre-prepared salads with Olives, Beans, Beetroot etc. http://image.ibb.co/cgZWZa/DSC00888.jpg This is the Teppanyaki stir fry section where you can choose your own ingredients and the chef will stir fry it for you! http://image.ibb.co/jjorZa/DSC00922.jpg ***Seasoned Vegetables and Kimchi*** http://image.ibb.co/cPvkcv/IMG_7832.jpg ***Freshly roasted meat!*** http://image.ibb.co/hfAkcv/IMG_7835.jpg ***Sushi Bar***. The Sushi bar was surprisingly varied. There was all sorts of sushi rolls, nigiri's and even sashimi's. http://image.ibb.co/gj5JVF/IMG_9775.jpg ![IMG_7833.jpg](https://steemitimages.com/DQmUHCokvGroV5vG3Lrb5xNFKCgCgY91J9U9edBE6MnKPYZ/IMG_7833.jpg) http://image.ibb.co/kpSXqF/IMG_9773.jpg ***Pizza and make your own pizza*** http://image.ibb.co/mkn77v/DSC00891.jpg http://image.ibb.co/mP8Env/DSC00892.jpg http://image.ibb.co/mY9vcv/IMG_7865.jpg http://image.ibb.co/nf6acv/IMG_7864.jpg http://image.ibb.co/fwTz4a/IMG_7863.jpg ***Hot Food section with various curry's, meat stews, vegetable stews etc.*** http://image.ibb.co/d3RZnv/DSC00893.jpg http://image.ibb.co/iTHJEa/DSC00894.jpg ***Boiled Broccoli, Jamaican Rice, Mediterranean Rice*** http://image.ibb.co/iqUn7v/DSC00895.jpg ***Crab Salad, Conch Salad, Shrimps Calamari Vinaigrette, Fish Cerviche*** http://image.ibb.co/hM9WZa/DSC00897.jpg This looks like some sort of curry and Baked Pastry. http://image.ibb.co/i0R0Sv/DSC00889.jpg Meat lovers will love this section with ***Sausages, Grilled Chicken Breast, Grilled Steaks and Grilled Salmon***. http://image.ibb.co/eAZLSv/DSC00903.jpg The seafood section is perhaps my favourite, it has ***Pealed Shrimps, Smoked Salmon and Mussels***. http://image.ibb.co/dek5ua/DSC00919.jpg Mediterranean foods have a very good representation. http://image.ibb.co/dGnJEa/DSC00901.jpg http://image.ibb.co/i73AAF/IMG_7862.jpg http://image.ibb.co/mbuiVF/IMG_7860.jpg http://image.ibb.co/jNuvcv/IMG_7861.jpg http://image.ibb.co/kPKHqF/IMG_7857.jpg http://image.ibb.co/frzHqF/IMG_7856.jpg ***Make your own Tortilla!*** http://image.ibb.co/muCw0F/DSC00921.jpg Bread lovers will have no problem finding one that suits their taste. http://image.ibb.co/gx3Env/DSC00898.jpg #### Desserts! Perhaps the most comprehensive section of all, the cakes and desserts! http://image.ibb.co/iqYQua/DSC00927.jpg http://image.ibb.co/c46OfF/DSC00928.jpg http://image.ibb.co/my3Qua/DSC00929.jpg http://image.ibb.co/bRRfAF/IMG_7854.jpg ![IMG_7847.jpg](https://steemitimages.com/DQmYbNyWfdJjCXsEqv4YBaW7yNrZ3gzF6F4MvkbQT6CBZQU/IMG_7847.jpg) http://image.ibb.co/daQ1Hv/IMG_7869.jpg http://image.ibb.co/iADz4a/IMG_7868.jpg http://image.ibb.co/dNPTxv/IMG_7867.jpg http://image.ibb.co/knf1Hv/IMG_7866.jpg http://image.ibb.co/hyqwja/IMG_7829.jpg http://image.ibb.co/nqGDVF/IMG_7828.jpg ## http://image.ibb.co/cL4iVF/IMG_7875.jpg ***Ben & Jerry's*** has their own stand here! I of course obliged. ![IMG_9780.jpg](https://steemitimages.com/DQmShmGSGs7YYHMtCqtJbaFBNhY7QZVic1gRdGgB9w1pRGV/IMG_9780.jpg) To celebrate a true banquet, a surprise mini ***Junkanoo*** sprung out of no where. All the restaurant staff and waiters started dancing and playing on the drums as they paraded around the eating area. Check out the video below and see for yourself! https://youtu.be/aHE3dWAx86c
Poseidon's table is an eatery of epic proportions. There is very little chance that you will not find something you enjoy eating at this place. More likely, you will find it hard to choose what delights to eat and end up missing out on many delicious foods by the time you are full. My visit entitled me to but a taste of the food from Poseidon's very ample table and has left me in awe of the food the Atlantians are able to enjoy. I would recommend fasting an entire day before attempting to conquer this restaurant. Even then, you will likely be defeated by the onslaught of food. At least you will walk away with a personal victory! (And a very big belly!) If you liked this post, please support with an upvote, follow me for more exciting and mouth watering blogs, and leave a comment to let me know what you think!

node.title: Myth or Fact? #31 â€“ The great Wall of China can be seen from the Moon
node.author: timsaid
node.body:
https://steemitimages.com/DQmbtKu6EZgb9FHFtyoab9NNGBDbFFSobi3gTSukP5GrVxR/china-2091360_1920.jpg
_Welcome my dear Steemian friends to a new episode of **Myth or Fact!** A series in which we will show that some common believes are myths while others turn out to be true._
_â€œ...3, 2 ,1, Lift off!â€_. Being pressed hard against your seat the rocket takes off. You feel the adrenaline rushing through every single cell of your body. With an insane speed you are on your way towards moon! _Don't forget to take Steem with you._ The lunar distance is approximately 385,000 km and it would take you around 3 days to get there. Finally you reached your destination and placed your foot on the surface of the moon. You look towards earth and see the perfect blue marble. What a beautiful view that only very few people in the history of humanity were granted to see live. And there you see it, China! You know it's China since you can see _The great Wall of China._ With 6350 km length it's the largest building on earth. But let's slow down for a second. Can we humans really see buildings from the moon? What's your guess? Today we will discover the truth behind this myth.
https://steemitimages.com/DQmZ852ebAgrHwsFnbxwcfJbvwTWWXGXZCLZypq8M3kpkrt/world-549425_640.jpg
_Let's go!_

Human eyesight

We will talk about the resolution of the human eye and and in short how eyesight works. If you want to know more about the sensation of sight I recommend you to read my post [Life Explorers - The Human Senses Part I: Sight](https://steemit.com/science/@timsaid/steemit-explorers-the-human-senses-part-i-sight). Our retina has approximately 6 million cones and 120 million rods. When the reflected light hits our retina these cells become active. We have three different type of cone cells, S(-hort), M-(medium) and L-(ong) cones. Short, medium and long refer to the wavelength the cell is responding to. The rods however can work with different wavelengths and thus do not matter when it comes to color. They are responsible for brightness and become active when there is less light. While the cones are active and working we speak of photopic vision, responsible for color sight. Scotopic vision is the terminus for sight in low light and only seeing in shades of gray. Â Â 
Fig. 1 Eye and retinal profile. Source: Kevinmd

As described the human retina has three kinds of cones. Each sensitive to a different wavelength. The following illustrations depicts the relation of wavelength and cones. These three cones together make it possible that we see colors. By combining cones we are able to see over 200 million different colors.

Fig. 2 Spectral sensitivity of the receptor (rods and cones). Source: Wikibooks; Sensory Systems

What really matters it the resolution of the human eye, the distinguishability of very fine structures and the visual acuity. If you have been to a eye doctor you might know this chart with letters. They become smaller and smaller and you will notice it becomes harder and harder to identify the letters. This has something to do with your acuity.
https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9f/Snellen_chart.svg/385px-Snellen_chart.svg.png
Fig. 3 Snellen chart [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Snellen_chart.svg)
Acuity is a property of our cones. The area on the retina with the highest density of cones is called fovea and is in the center of the retina. This is the spot where we have the highest acuity and see the sharpest. The acuity drops radically from there.
https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/27/AcuityHumanEye.svg/318px-AcuityHumanEye.svg.png
Fig. 4 Acuity of human eye [Source](https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:AcuityHumanEye.svg)
To keep it simple: It's is **not** possible to see any buildings on earth. The limiting factor is the resolution of the human eye. In Fact you won't even be able to see specific countries. From a distance of over 380,000 km all you can see is blue and white. The clouds would make it more or less impossible to see the buildings, besides they are too small to be seen. Charles M. Duke (Apollo 16) and Eugene A. Cernan (Apollo 17) both confirmed they were not able to see any structures from the moon.

node.title: INCREDIBLE MAIL FROM AN AMAZING COMMUNITY - YOU'VE GOTTA SEE THIS!
node.author: papa-pepper
node.body:
http://i.imgur.com/HGoKK5s.jpg

## <center>Steemians never cease to amaze me!</center>

-----------
I let my mail build up a little bit to make this video, but I think that it was worth the hard time I had waiting!

https://img1.steemit.com/0x0/http://i.imgur.com/uVNBbyL.jpg
## <center>VIDEO - PAPA OPENS THE MAIL!</center>

https://youtu.be/i-Y1WNLfRp8

https://img1.steemit.com/0x0/http://i.imgur.com/uVNBbyL.jpg

### <center>For those of you who don't watch the videos, I'll give you a quick rundown of what I received.</center>

-----------
## <center>@liberty-minded</center>

http://i.imgur.com/JStSRRN.jpg

This guy knew that I like hot sauce, so he spent over $20 just on shipping to send me a bottle of his favorite kind! Please join me in thanking @liberty-minded for his generous gift! Thanks man!

https://img1.steemit.com/0x0/http://i.imgur.com/uVNBbyL.jpg

## <center>@jonny-clearwater</center>

http://i.imgur.com/FlBXJO5.jpg

http://i.imgur.com/2num6ax.jpg

This incredible t-shirt was sent as a trade that we worked out. I sent him one of my handmade "DON'T POST FOR FREE - steemit.com" shirts and he mailed me one of these that he designed! Very cool stuff and an excellent trade. Check out @jonny-clearwater and/or his wife @flowerpowerart if you have not already done so. Thanks! I'll be wearing it!


https://img1.steemit.com/0x0/http://i.imgur.com/uVNBbyL.jpg

## <center>@louiscpt</center>

http://i.imgur.com/DGikP3A.jpg

http://i.imgur.com/EbQx5AN.jpg

A huge pile of gifts came to me all the way from South Africa. Check out the personalized envelope, and the interesting stamps. If that wasn't enough, you'll have to look at what was inside!

--------------
http://i.imgur.com/II02R73.jpg

http://i.imgur.com/Moh5Nrm.jpg

First off, I received this incredible, personalized, embroidered long-sleeve STEEM-POCALYPSE shirt! This was huge! What a gift!

-----------------
http://i.imgur.com/UIbFzLL.jpg

Then, there was this amazing STEEM-POCALYPSE hat that not only featured my favorite color (camouflage) but it also actually fit on my giant head! Super cool.

--------------
http://i.imgur.com/McxJy6n.jpg

http://i.imgur.com/gwfG0la.jpg

And.... if that wasn't enough (and it was) I also found this fantastic t-shirt inside. Another personalized shirt featuring the STEEM-POCALYPSE logo, the @papa-pepper logo, *and* a photo of me holding one of my Wild Friends, the Pygmy Rattlesnake! This was mind-blowing! What a great set of gifts! You guys should definitely check out what else @louiscpt has been up to on his blog page.

https://img1.steemit.com/0x0/http://i.imgur.com/uVNBbyL.jpg
## <center>PAPA LOVES THIS STUFF!</center>

I know that even though I've been on steemit for almost a year now I am still a newcomer to online interaction and social media. I also know that many may consider giving out mailing addresses and meeting people from the internet in person to be some big "no-nos." However, I'm still new at all of this, and so far the steemit community has seriously impressed me.

These gifts are just one small example of how steemit has taken things to an entirely different level that what so many other online platforms have achieved. Honestly, I am so blessed to be a part of this steemit community and you guys mean a lot to me. Steem on my friends, steem on!

https://img1.steemit.com/0x0/http://i.imgur.com/uVNBbyL.jpg

## As always, I'm @papa-pepper and here's the proof:
http://i.imgur.com/JBFNKlm.jpg
proof-of-some-of-the-best-mail-ever

--------------
----------
#### <center>Until next timeâ€¦</center>
